intro: Lastrea edentula, commonly known as the toothless lastrea, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, known for its succulent characteristics. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically appear in shades of yellow or orange, blooming during the warmer months. Lastrea edentula is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems to survive in dry conditions.
